meanings.definition: A collection of literary extracts or quotations.
meanings.sent1: The florilegia contained famous quotes from Shakespeare and Dickens.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading the florilegia of inspirational sayings.
meanings.sent3: The florilegia of jokes made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a florilegia of memories, each one carefully preserved.
meanings.sent5: The florilegia of wisdom passed down through generations was a treasure to behold.

meanings.definition: A compilation of writings on a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The florilegia on ancient history was a valuable resource for researchers.
meanings.sent2: He spent hours studying the florilegia of scientific articles.
meanings.sent3: The florilegia of recipes in her kitchen drawer was a mess.
meanings.sent4: His notebook was a florilegia of ideas waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The florilegia of stories about the town's history fascinated the children.

meanings.definition: An anthology of flowers or plants.
meanings.sent1: The florilegia in the botanical garden showcased a variety of exotic plants.
meanings.sent2: She admired the florilegia of wildflowers blooming in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The florilegia of roses in her backyard attracted many bees.
meanings.sent4: The forest was a florilegia of colors during the autumn season.
meanings.sent5: The florilegia of tulips in the park created a beautiful spring display.
